author: Uno Platform
name: Multi-Platform App (Uno.Extensions)
description: Solution template for creating a multi-platform C# & XAML application targeting Windows App SDK, Android, iOS, macOS, WebAssembly, Skia/WPF and Skia/GTK for Linux.
symbols/template-type/description: Selects whether to use the default Extensions Template or Blank App
symbols/architecture/description: Selects either MVVM or MVU-X for the design architecture.
symbols/architecture/choices/mvux/descri: Use the MVU-X design pattern with Uno.Extensions.Reactive
symbols/ui-markup/description: Selects either XAML or C# Markup for the UI.
symbols/ui-markup/choices/csharp/descrip: Use C# Markup for the UI
symbols/app-theme/description: Selects the theme design system for the application.
symbols/android/description: Enables the Android platform in the Mobile support project
symbols/ios/description: Enables the iOS platform in the Mobile support project
symbols/maccatalyst/description: Enables the macOS (Catalyst) platform in the Mobile support project
symbols/macos/description: Enables the macOS (AppKit) platform in the Mobile support project
symbols/skia-gtk/displayName: Desktop - Gtk (Linux, macOS, Windows 7 or later)
symbols/skia-gtk/description: Enables the Skia/GTK platform support project
symbols/skia-wpf/description: Enables the Skia/WPF platform support project
symbols/skia-linux-fb/description: Enables the Skia/Linux FrameBuffer platform support project
symbols/winAppSdk/description: Enables the Windows App Sdk platform support project
symbols/wasm/description: Enables the WebAssembly platform support project
symbols/server/description: Includes a Server project for an API & host for the WebAssembly project
symbols/serilog/description: Includes Uno.Extensions.Logging.Serilog when logging is enabled
symbols/navigation/description: Sets the base type of navigation used in the app.
symbols/navigation/choices/default/descr: Provides a simple 2 page sample with a Splash Screen.
symbols/navigation/choices/frame/descrip: Uses the Frame control for navigation.
symbols/cpm/description: Whether or not to use Central Package Management - package versions are via central Directory.Packages.props file
symbols/vscode/description: Adds the Visual Studio Code Debugging support files for WebAssembly
symbols/wasm-pwa-manifest/description: Enables the generation of a PWA manifest for WebAssembly
symbols/skipRestore/description: If specified, skips the automatic restore of the project on create.
